text: common mistakes in English lesson three
let's talk more about how we asked
people to perform an action in addition
to using imperatives we can use
questions some common questions for
making requests are can you or could you
will you or would you note that could
you and would you are more polite so
from less polite to more polite here are
some examples can you show me or will
you show me can you show me please will
you show me please could you show me or
would you show me could you show me
please would you show me please so you
see again that could and would are more
polite and please always makes any
question more polite additional requests
do you mind cooking dinner tonight
would you mind mailing a letter for me
would it be too much trouble to pick me
up from work take a note of the grammar
do you mind would you mind takes a verb
in the ing the last expression would it
be too much trouble combines with the
infinitive
asking people not to do something
sometimes it's best to use the
imperative especially if it's a matter
of safety this is called a warning you
are telling someone not to do something
dangerous
for example slow down don't fall but in
other situations it's more appropriate
to ask a person not to do something for
example would you please stop doing that
when you ask someone not to do something
you can employ your wishes instead of
stating them directly this is considered
more tactful tactful means you're
behaving in a way that doesn't upset
others so here are some examples of
implied requests not to do something I
really wish you would stop calling me
little girl
in other words you're saying don't call
me little girl I wish you wouldn't be so
negative in other words don't be so
negative it might help if you did a
little more around the house in other
words I want you to help more around the
house you know it wouldn't hurt to call
more often in other words I want you to
call more often
sometimes the speaker uses we in a
statement but the meaning is really you
this is done to make a request less like
a command and more like a suggestion or
reminder for example a parent might say
let's not call each other names
let's stop and try another exercise
comprehension check to read each
statement and identify the situation
sometimes more than one answer is
possible example please get back to work
don't waste your time or mine what's the
situation a an employee speaking to a
boss be a boss speaking to an employee
or c1 employees speaking to another
answer be
these requests are too direct for an
employee to use with a boss and for one
employee to use these requests with
another is unnatural one employee with
another would more likely use
suggestions such as let's get back to
work number one I wish you'd stop doing
that
what's the situation a a police officer
speaking to a dangerous driver be a
student speaking to a teacher who often
forgets the student's name see a person
speaking to a friend who often
criticizes himself answer see a police
officer speaking to a driver would not
use an implied request they would need
to speak more directly and use a warning
stop driving dangerously stop doing that
and in the case of the student it would
be best not even to make a request but
to simply give a reminder the student
can simply tell the teacher what his
name is number two let's wash our hands
we wash our hands before eating what's
the situation
a apparent speaking to a child be a
doctor speaking to a patient see a
hostess speaking to a dinner guests
answer a
a doctor would not speak this way to a
patient doctors give directions
instructions and warnings the hostess
would also not speak in this manner a
hostess would most likely make an offer
such as would she care to wash up before
dinner number three would it be too much
trouble to move the bed near the window
what's the situation
a a young child speaking to her parent
be a guest speaking to the hotel staff
see a home owners speaking to hired
furniture movers
answer be
a child would not use such a request
it's a little too formal too long the
chod would simply ask can we move the
bed near the window see is also possible
but in this situation there are likely
many pieces of furniture and to take the
time to be polite making requests for
every single piece of furniture it's
just too much number four will you call
me but don't call after 9:00 okay what's
the situation a a girlfriend speaking to
her boyfriend be a jobseeker speaking to
a job interviewer see a patient speaking
to a receptionist at the doctor's office
answer a a jobseeker needs to remain
formal and polite the job seeker could
ask might I expect your call may I
expect your call will you be calling me
the job seeker should also not be too
demanding so it would be best to say
something such as please call me at your
convenience a patient should also be
polite when speaking to receptionist the
patient could ask will you please return
my call to state a specific time the
patient could say please call me anytime
before 9 o'clock that's the end of part
2 be sure to check out part 3
